title: What is the significance of Lead and Tin in alchemy, and how do they relate to the nature of transformation?
first_phrase: In this final part of the text, the author urges the reader to understand the importance and nature of lead and tin, and how they need to be combined correctly for the alchemical process to be successful. The author advises the reader to study and understand the principles of how nature works in regards to putrefaction, generation, and renewal, as well as the exchange of love and the inevitability of corruption. The author also emphasizes the need to focus on the essential elements of the alchemical process and discusses the importance of cooking and the special state of subtlety and weightlessness. Finally, the author discusses the transformation of white into red, which symbolizes the time of God and His coming to glorify the just.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the process of transmutation and purification of nature, as described by the alchemists, requires shedding unnecessary things and focusing on the vital elements. By utilizing the living water and the incombustible sulfur of the body, one can achieve glorification and perfect unity of body, spirit, and soul. It is a difficult path, reserved only for the wise, but the rewards are beyond measure.
